column4: hello, i'm using ubuntu desktop and I wanna connect remotely through a VNC connection. Which is the best VNC server/client out there?????
and vino is the default server installed in ubuntu is what I was saying.
have you tried using the tight encoding
speeds things up quite a bit
yeah but your really dont' need a color depth of 24 do you for remote desktop?
also make sure your windows client is specifying tight encoding
is it still to slow then?
i'm not really following what you mean by its limited?
you can also try freenx everything is free so there's really no trouble from tryign different ones
